articles.description: Binance to spend its BUSD stablecoin on scooping up Bitcoin, Ethereum, and its native BNB token, the firm's CEO said.
articles.title: Binance Swaps BUSD Stablecoin From 'Recovery Fund' to Bitcoin, Ethereum, BNB

articles.description: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.
articles.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity

articles.description: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.
articles.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'

articles.description: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.
articles.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past

articles.description: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."
articles.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'

articles.description: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.
articles.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young

articles.description: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.
articles.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs

articles.description: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.
articles.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets

articles.description: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.
articles.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'

articles.description: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX, the exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.
articles.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'

articles.description: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.
articles.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid

articles.description: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.
articles.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse

articles.description: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
articles.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver

articles.description: Mihai Crasneanu, Co-founder and CEO of Beem, describes Beem as "a mix of YouTube, Twitch, Zoom, and Clubhouse" that runs as a decentralized platform. He talked to Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how it all works and how the platform is growing.
articles.title: CEO of Video Streaming Platform Beem: Decentralization Lets 'Creators Regain Their Autonomy'

articles.description: Miguel Faus funded his upcoming film "Calladita" via NFT sales and a prize grant from Decentralized Pictures and Steven Soderbergh. He told Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris about how the film process is progressing and how Web3 moves so quickly that the NFT funding model he used is already a thing of the past and other filmmakers need to find other ways to keep pushing the envelope.
articles.title: 'Calladita' Director Says NFT Funding Model He Used Is Already Gone Because Web3 Moves So Fast

articles.description: Coinbase protocols lead Jesse Pollak sat down with Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver 2023 to talk about the company's innovation strategy and its plans to keep "iterating quickly" on products like Coinbase NFT and its newly announced Layer-2 blockchain Base and its efforts to become an "on-chain-native company."
articles.title: Coinbase Protocols Lead Talks Plans for Base and NFT Marketplace

articles.description: Josie Bellini, NFT artist and creator of CyberBrokers, tells Decrypt's Stephen Graves at NFT Paris how CyberBrokers creates "missions and quests" for its holders to complete that lead them to other hubs like Cryptovoxels, Mona, and other projects "so that we're not just in our own silo."
articles.title: How CyberBrokers Creates Quests Across Multiple NFT Communities: Josie Bellini

articles.description: Bolero co-founder and CEO William Bailey tells Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris how Bolero works, the vision behind letting fans of an artist own a piece of a song, the future for music NFTs, and how Web3 can change the music industry broadly.
articles.title: Web3 Music Platform Bolero Wants to 'Put a Record Label in Everyone's Pocket'

articles.description: French electronic music producer DJ Agoria told Decrypt's Dan Roberts what excites him most about music NFTs, how it informs his work as a generative artist, and why Web3 is all about artists exploring "new ideas that were not possible in Web2."
articles.title: 'We Don't Want to Make Music NFTs Mainstream': DJ Agoria

articles.description: Adidas Web3 lead Erika Wykes-Sneyd told Decrypt's Dan Roberts the story of what prompted Adidas to get into crypto (it involves Elon Musk), what the brand has done so far with NFTs tied to physical apparel, and what it's considering next—including token-gated sneaker drops.
articles.title: How Adidas Jumped Into Web3 and What It Plans Next

articles.description: Eva Assayag, Web3 lead at Panerai, sat down with Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris to talk about Panerai's Web3 strategy, which will soon include a "digital passport" sold with every watch.
articles.title: Why 160-Year-Old Luxury Watch Maker Panerai Is Getting into NFTs

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
India’s central bank, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), and the Central Bank of the United Arab Emirates (UAE) have agreed to collaborate on cross-border central bank digital currency (CBDC) transactions of remittances and trade. The initiative is “expected to reduce costs, increase efficiency of cross border transactions and further the economic ties between India and UAE,” India’s central bank explained.
 
India and UAE Collaborate on CBDCs
 
India’s central bank, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI), announced Wednesday a collaboration with the Central Bank of the United Arab Emirates to enhance both countries’ central bank digital currency (CBDC) efforts.
 
“The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) and the Central Bank of the United Arab Emirates (CBUAE) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) tod…
articles.title: India, UAE Collaborate to Boost Cross-Border Central Bank Digital Currency Transactions

articles.author: Sam Reynolds, Shaurya Malwa
articles.description: ALSO: CoinDesk's Shaurya Malwa writes that higher-than-usual market volatility affected bulls and bears alike as crypto futures racked up $300 million in liquidations over a 24-hour period earlier this week.
articles.title: First Mover Asia: Bitcoin Dips Below $25K as Market Debates Liquidity

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
Market strategist Greg Foss has predicted that Credit Suisse will be the next major bank to collapse, citing capital trouble and a run on the bank. The Swiss banking giant has also identified “material weaknesses” in its financial reporting controls. Its shares plunged on Wednesday after the bank failed to raise capital from its largest investor.
 
Credit Suisse Next to Fall, Says Strategist
 
Market strategist Greg Foss warned about the impending collapse of Swiss banking giant Credit Suisse on the Coin Stories podcast, published Tuesday. His warning followed the collapses of several major U.S. banks, including Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank.
 
Foss is currently executive director at Validus Power Corp. He was a founding shareholder of 3iQ Corp. and previously held the role of sen…
articles.title: Strategist Warns Credit Suisse Next to Collapse — Says ‘There’s a Run on the Bank’

articles.description: The U.S. Federal Reserve is activating its long-awaited real-time payments system in July, the central bank said in a Wednesday statement, marking a transition that some have seen as a government challenge of the crypto sector’s instant-transaction advantages.
articles.title: U.S. Federal Reserve’s Real-Time Payments System Coming In July

articles.author: Kevin Helms
articles.description:
Michael Burry, a hedge fund manager renowned for predicting the 2008 financial crisis, has drawn parallels between the current banking turmoil and the Panic of 1907. He noted that three weeks after J.P. Morgan made a stand, the panic was resolved and the markets bottomed. “A stand was made this past weekend,” the famous investor pointed out.
 
Michael Burry on Bank Failures, Panic of 1907, Markets Bottoming
 
Famous investor and founder of investment firm Scion Asset Management, Michael Burry, has compared the current financial turmoil, following the collapse of multiple banks, to the Panic of 1907. Burry is best known for being the first investor to foresee and profit from the U.S. subprime mortgage crisis that occurred between 2007 and 2010. He is profiled in “The Big Short,” a book by M…
articles.title: Michael Burry Compares Current Banking Turmoil to Panic of 1907 — Highlights Markets Bottoming

articles.author: Jocelyn Yang
articles.description: BTC dropped as low as $23,946 Wednesday midday before pulling back above the $24,000 mark. Equity markets also struggled on the Swiss banking giant news.
articles.title: Bitcoin Slides Below $24.5K as European Banking Woes Spook Investors

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
Taxpayers in the United Kingdom will have to report cryptocurrency assets separately in their tax documents for the tax year 2024-25, according to the Exchequer’s recently published spring 2023 budget.
 
New Criminal Offenses Planned by U.K. Government to Combat Tax Avoidance
 
Amid the chaos in the banking sector following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank’s U.K. subsidiary, finance minister Jeremy Hunt delivered the spring 2023 budget on Wednesday. Hunt, who was previously dealing with the bank’s failure, told BBC reporters that the shutdown of the U.K. financial institution posed no immediate danger to the British financial system. The budget, published by the Treasury, discusses the decisions the U.K. government has made to “restore economic stability, support public services, and la…
articles.title: UK Treasury Budget Discusses Separate Reporting of Crypto Assets in Tax Documents

articles.author: Hououin Kyouma
articles.description:
Data from Glassnode has revealed that the Bitcoin supply is gradually dispersing from whales and exchanges to smaller hands with time.
 
Bitcoin Supply Is Slowly Showing Dispersal Towards Smaller Holders
 
According to a new report published by the on-chain analytics firm Glassnode, investors holding less than 50 BTC have recently absorbed the most significant volume of coins.
 
Something that BTC critics often hold up against the cryptocurrency is the distribution of the supply. They argue that the supply is heavily concentrated around a few whales, providing the existence of large wallets as evidence.
 
To check whether this fact holds, Glassnode studied the supply distribution of the market by breaking down investors into different cohorts. These holder groups are defined by the analyti…
articles.title: Bitcoin Supply Is Becoming Less Concentrated On Whales With Time, Glassnode Reveals

articles.author: Cheyenne Ligon
articles.description: U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) Chairman Gary Gensler is doubling down on his opinion that proof-of-stake tokens could meet the definition of securities under the Howey test, thus bringing them under his agency’s regulatory authority.
articles.title: SEC Chairman Gensler Suggests Again That Proof-of-Stake Tokens Are Securities: Report

articles.author: Brandy Betz
articles.description: SEC filings show fundraises for two versions of the ARK Crypto Revolutions fund.
articles.title: Cathie Wood’s Ark Raises $16.3M for New Private Crypto Fund

articles.author: Cheyenne Ligon
articles.description: Exiled Chinese businessman Guo Wengui was arrested in New York on Wednesday morning and charged with fraud for allegedly orchestrating a series of fraudulent schemes that bilked retail investors out of a collective $1.4 billion.
articles.title: Chinese Businessman With Ties to Steve Bannon Arrested, Charged With Fraud, Including $500M Crypto Scam

articles.author: Fran Velasquez
articles.description: Brian Brooks, former head of the OCC and now board member of blockchain technology company Bitfury, says the recent crackdown by regulators on three crypto-friendly banks appears to be a coordinated effort and what some are dubbing "Operation Choke Point 2.0"
articles.title: Bitfury CEO: U.S. Government Using Crisis to Choke Off Crypto Access to Banks

articles.author: Jesse Hamilton
articles.description: Ideas have been gathered from the Senate and House, and lawmakers are trying to figure out what can get bipartisan support, said Senate Banking Committee member Thom Tillis.
articles.title: U.S. Lawmakers Digging Through Crypto Legislation for Bipartisan Winners: Senator

articles.author: Jamie Redman
articles.description:
After dropping below $26,000 per unit, the price of bitcoin, the leading digital asset by market capitalization, is still up 9.6% since last week. However, its price has decreased by 6.5% in the last 24 hours. Out of the 7,316 companies, crypto assets, precious metals, and exchange-traded funds worth more than $82 trillion in value, bitcoin is the 12th largest asset worldwide by valuation.
 
Bitcoin’s Market Capitalization Compared to Other Top Assets: Leading Crypto Climbs Above Visa, But Lags Behind Meta
 
Crypto assets, specifically bitcoin (BTC), have increased in value this week following the collapse of three major U.S. banks. Over the past 24 hours, bitcoin (BTC) has dropped 6.5% against the U.S. dollar. However, weekly metrics indicate that BTC is up 9.6% week over week. Most of BT…
articles.title: Bitcoin Becomes 12th Largest Asset Worldwide by Valuation, Surpassing Visa

articles.author: Savannah Fortis
articles.description:
Almost half a billion SHIB tokens have been removed from circulation in 24 hours, spiking its burn rate. According to data from Shibburn, approximately 455 million Shiba Inu tokens have been burned in the last 24 hours, a 1,322.79% rise in burn rate within a day.
 
One of the mechanisms that check the over-saturation of an asset in the crypto market is burning. Many uncapped crypto assets rely on the mechanism to remove a large number of coins in circulations, thereby limiting supply and maintaining relevance. Shiba Inu is one of the tokens that have engaged in token burns. 
 
 
Aside from today’s burn activity, Shibburn recorded massive burn rates over the past few days after the launch of the Shibarium beta testnet, PuppyNet. As of March 9, before the beta launch, Shiba Inu burn rates su…
articles.title: PuppyNet Launch Spikes SHIB Burn Rate By 1,318%
